summary: Absenteeism refers to the habitual failure of employees to attend work, which can significantly impact organizational efficiency and employee morale. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, absenteeism is addressed through various directives aimed at improving working conditions and promoting employee well-being. The EU emphasizes the importance of a healthy work-life balance, which can mitigate absenteeism rates. Regulations may include provisions for sick leave, flexible working arrangements, and measures to support mental health. By fostering a supportive work environment, the EU aims to reduce absenteeism and enhance overall productivity within member states.
